text: a sign of trouble on the horizon this is
the view of North Sinai from Gaza hours
of intense clashes between Egyptian
security forces and Islamic state have
left dozens of competence and civilians
dead simultaneous raids were launched on
military checkpoints and a police
station it's one of the largest
coordinated assaults yet by militants in
the Sinai the area has become a key
battleground for Egypt but what happens
in the strategically important Peninsula
is also a concern for Egypt's neighbors
we see Isis at the gates across the
border in the Golan across the border in
Egypt we send our condolences to the
government and people of Egypt for the
Fallen Egyptians slayed by Isis terror
we must stand up to all the forces of
militant Islam those led by Iran those
led by Isis these are the militants
behind the attacks they pledged
allegiance to is in November rebranding
themselves the Sinai province of Islamic
state experts say their numbers are
growing steadily and their attacks
becoming more sophisticated earlier this
week a car bomb attack in Cairo killed a
high-profile public prosecutor analysts
say the assassination bore the hallmarks
of Sinai province militants at the
funeral the president promised legal
reforms to ensure death sentences could
be enforced more swiftly for those
convicted of acts of terrorism North
Sinai has been under a state of
emergency and a curfew since October
after an attack killed dozens of
soldiers the army has stepped up its
presence along the border with Gaza a
buffer zone has been created communities
of homes destroyed in the bid to find
underground tunnels the military says
they're being used to smuggle weapons in
from the Palestinian enclaves
despite this the Army has yet to uproot
the militants and the
intensification of this week's attacks
show the still a long battle ahead Tim
Nielsen BBC news
